definitions.definition: Present in a canon , religious or otherwise.
examples: The Gospel of Luke is a canonical New Testament book.

definitions.definition: According to recognised or orthodox rules .
examples: The men played golf in the most canonical way, with no local rules.

definitions.definition: Stated or used in the most basic and straightforwardly applicable manner.
examples: the reduction of a linear substitution to its canonical form

definitions.definition: In the form of a canon .
Of or pertaining to an ecclesiastical chapter
Distinguished among entities of its kind, so that it can be picked out in a way that does not depend on any arbitrary choices.
Related to or part of the canon of a fictional universe .

main_definition: Present in a canon , religious or otherwise.
secondary_definitions: According to recognised or orthodox rules .
Stated or used in the most basic and straightforwardly applicable manner.
( religion ) In conformity with canon law .
( music ) In the form of a canon .
( religion ) Of or pertaining to an ecclesiastical chapter
( mathematics ) Distinguished among entities of its kind, so that it can be picked out in a way that does not depend on any arbitrary choices.
( fandom slang ) Related to or part of the canon of a fictional universe .
